items.text: shot of the morning! How he leeeeeans into that cover drive! Even as that ball swings away, attempting to escape his magic hands. But Hope holds his shape, moves his front leg across to the ball, gets nice and low over the ball, and then gently directs it to the boundary
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length and outside off, lets it go
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: blocks the fuller delivery on off stump to mid-off
items.postText: Liam: "Are there a few selection dilemmas for the windies at the World Cup with how well their second string openers have performed? Surely one of the three century making openers must play in the World Cup? " --- Think Hope might slip down to No. 3. And Ambris (assuming he's in the squad) slips in as Gayle's partner.
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: loads up the drive again but finds mid-off
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: blocks the good length ball that shapes into the right-hander just a tiny bit
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: another glorious drive from Hope, this time straighter of cover. There's a man inside the circle, diving to his right to save a certain boundary. Delicious strokeplay starting from the measured front foot stride and the conscious decision to only time the ball
items.postText: Stuart: "This looms as another World Cup to butcher bowlers. Seriously, who'd want to bowl to Windies / England in their current forms (and before you add Chris Gayle)? They might want to go back to one ball that gets old and soft. "
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 2 runs

items.text: pulls the short ball to deep square leg. Mashrafe looks ridiculously out of sorts this morning. Too slow. Too stiff. And too wayward
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: nudges a fuller delivery to mid-on
items.postText: Chris: "Dropping Evin Lewis would be a big call I think. Although he hasn't played a decent innings for ages!"
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length and outside off, lets it go
items.postText: Priyank: "Hope must open with C Gayle come world cup. He has had terrifc time opening the innings in last 2-3 series. Lewis could come at #3. As for Ambris i think he is still very raw in terms of experience in international cricket. "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: angles the shortish ball into the right-hander, and Ambris, even as he tries to make room, isn't able to get enough to play a full-blooded cut shot. Just a tap to point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: gooone! Tame end to a promising innings and Mashrafe barely celebrates. Just glowers at everything in sight as if blaming it for his poor form until this very moment, when a shortish delivery outside off stump is basically guided to a wide slip fielder like it's catching practice. Soumya dives to his right and picks up a smart catch
items.postText:
Darren Bravo's at No. 3

Ketan: "@Stuart, Smash, bang and wallop does not always win you Word Cup's, sometimes you need smart calculated batting and sides who can adopt to situations, for me India does that better than anyone."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, OUT

dismissal.text: SW Ambris c Soumya Sarkar b Mashrafe Mortaza 23 (26m 19b 4x4 0x6) SR: 121.05

items.text: good length, outside off, from round the wicket. Bravo covers the off stump and lets it go
items.postText: Seth: "One reason to keep Soumya in the squad is his fielding. Showed that there."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.preText:
Here's Mehidy, with a slip in place 

vivek bhandari: "what's the chances for Shai Hope to fail today? Asking for a friend who plays fantasy leagues" --- Slim to what the weird are you talking about?!?
items.text: loops it up on off stump, and a tame, loopy offbreak suddenly takes on threatening proportions when it dips on the right-hander. Hope has to hurry into a block
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: pushes forward and drives to mid-on. Good start from Mehidy. Targeting the stumps, lovely flight too
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Round the wicket to the left-hander
items.text: angles it into off stump and the full ball just straightens enough for Bravo to be wary of and defend
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Bravo, no run

items.text: this slides on with the arm - natural variation - and Bravo plays for turn, blocking on off stump, only to get an inside edge through square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Bravo, 1 run

items.text: lunges forward to try and get to the pitch of the ball a shade outside off, and though he isn't there, he tries to bring his wrists into the drive and try and whip the ball to cover. Doesn't quite pull it off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: this time he does reach the ball on the half-volley outside off and nails it to the long-off boundary
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, FOUR runs

items.preText: BanjarePrashant: "Darren Bravo needs to spend sometime at the crease as he looks rusty and in the last few years he played t20 cricket so he should run hard between the innings to make adrenaline flow before he can really launch the attack as he so often does in t20"
items.text: tries to tuck away the shortish delivery from round the wicket through midwicket. Can't hit the gap
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.text: goes for an on the up drive through the covers and because the ball gets big on him, he yanks the bottom hand off the bat
items.postText: Vicky: "@Ketan: Smash, bang and wallop did won the world cup for SL in 1996... They smashed and banged anything and everything to the boundaries in the first 15 overs with the fielding restrictions then... and their bowlers and fielders did wallop and put up a splendid performance..."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.text: launches it down the ground! Outrageous shot from Bravo. Just plants his front leg down and because there's room on offer he just goes after the ball. That means a short ball has been slapped straight down the ground. Wicked!
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length on off stump, Bravo defends
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.text: plays with soft hands, looking to pinch a single off a short ball that comes up to his chest. No such luck
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.text: good length on off stump, defends it
items.postText: Razaaq: "Hope seems to be very much like Imam ul Haq. Very capable batsmen but one feels their strike rates is a bit under par in the modern game. "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.preText: Shahriar: "BD bowlers has this nag of being a bunny of certain players that they can't get him out. Dhawan, tharanga, taylor, guptil. Now hope. Any hope of getting him out today?"
items.text: goes back to nudge a good length ball to midwicket. Hope wants the single, Bravo doesn't. And in the end, they recover from the mix-up
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run
